alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 9:05AM AKST until February 22 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snowfall of 3 to 6 inches expected. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Highway summits will have winds gusting to 25 mph and low visibility in blowing snow. * WHERE...Fairbanks north. * WHEN...3 PM today to 6 PM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest snow amounts north of Fairbanks. Highway summits will have winds gusting to 25 mph and low visibility in blowing snow. Snow will taper off Tuesday afternoon and winds over summits will taper off Tuesday evening. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
